alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Marshall; Maury; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:47AM CDT until April 01 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Lewis County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Marshall County in Middle Tennessee... Maury County in Middle Tennessee... South central Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 130 AM CDT. * At 1247 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Summertown, or 8 miles east of Hohenwald, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Columbia, Spring Hill, Mount Pleasant, Gordonsburg, Culleoka, Hampshire, I-65 East Of Columbia and Farmington. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 35 and 52. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
